discourse_list.title: Hosting A Maker track for Buidl for web3 Hackathon

content.content: 1.Context of the proposal: Over the last 4 years, we have executed over 50+ developer engagement programs for top web3 projects (like Polkadot, NEAR, Hedera Hashgraph, Polygon,etc) & have deployed over $10 Million into the hands of builders & now we are building a metaverse for developers to connect with opportunities in the web3 space in an experiential way. We will be launching our MVP by November 2022. Ahead of our launch, we are hosting a global hackathon where developers from all levels of proficiency will have an array of use cases to work with and win from a large prize pool. We would love to host a MakerDao  specific track in this hackathon. By joining us for this Hackathon, you’ll have early access to Lumos Metaverse where you can evangelize your platform to the users & participating developers through a MakerDao  Hub. 2. Proposed Solution - Buidl for Web3 Hackathon 2022 by Lumos Labs A mega developer engagement program hosted by Lumos Labs to celebrate the spirit of building A web3 focused chain agnostic hackathon where multiple platforms put out their use cases and add to the prize pool, giving developers across the globe an opportunity to pick and choose use cases & chains giving them power to choose their outcome. The hackathon is all set to engage 10,000 developers across the globe , checkout Hackathon website What it offers to Developers:  Pick a track of choice Choose difficulty levels Scout for team mates Build & win from a large prize money pool  What it offers MakerDao:  Evangelize MakerDao to participating developers Deploy Grants Hire top notch talent Get an early access to Lumos Metaverse  Hackathon Themes  Defi Entertainment Tooling & Infrastructure NFT Decentralized Identity Open innovation DAO Decentralized Social Media Metaverse Sustainability Decentralized Sharing Economy Products & custom themes of choice Custom Theme of MakerDao’s choice  Hackathon Community Partners As the scope of this hackathon is global, we have partnered with multiple communities to spread the word about the hackathon amongst their members to expand the scope. Few of our confirmed partners are depicted below International University Partners     University Club Name     University of Pennsylvania PENN Blockchain   University of San Diego Blockchain San Diego   Vanderbilt University     Other community partners & their Twitter reach     Partner Name Reach (Twitter)     IEEE 335.8 K   Developer Dao 72.2 K   Learn Web3 DAO 57.2 K   Buildspace 55K   TPH 39K   StackOS 35.2K   The dapp list 11.5 K   Web3Conf 8648   Questbook 8522   Blockchain Nigeria User Group 6007   Lirn.io 1506   Web3 Bharat 1376   StatesDAO 746   WebX DAO 685   Truts 460   CryptoDevHub 319   Web3 Devs 267    Commercials     Category Investment     Track Sponsorship USD 25,000   Contribution to Prize pool USD 10,000   Total USD 35,000    |Associate Sponsorship|USD 5,000| |Contribution to Prize pool|USD 5,000| |Total|USD 10,000| MakerDao Presence in the Hackathon Marketing Plan  College Road Shows : Lumos Lab’s Developer Relations & Community team will be conducting IRL events in 6 + top universities in India and the MakerDao logo will be displayed on every marketing collateral during such events. Email marketing : MakerDao logo inclusion in all mailer promotions Lumos Labs does to its 60 K developer community Virtual Events: During the Build phase , we will be organizing a MakerDao specific workshop in association with our hackathon partners. Lumos Labs shall be organizing this virtual event and doing all promotions. Lumos Labs have identified a pool of mentors who can lead the programs.( List is shared after this section) Podcast/ Video Series : One representative from MakerDao will be featured in a MakerDao exclusive Podcast which will be hosted by Lumos Labs MakerDao inclusions in all of the below marketing activities   Social Media Promotions: Twitter, LinkedIn , Facebook,Instagram Community Promotions : Both Lumos Community & Hackathon Partner Communities All associated PR & Media announcements
Perfect timing with the recent discussion around the events core unit. Would love to see them diversify their events into hackathons like this moving forward.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
